alert.note: Alert for Western Addison; Western Chittenden (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 23 at 2:22PM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Essex, northwestern Addison and west central Chittenden Counties through 330 PM EDT... At 222 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Elizabethtown, moving east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Essex, Willsboro, Westport, Elizabethtown, Kingsland Bay State Park, Ferrisburgh, Charlotte, Shelburne, Lewis, Fort Cassin Point, Mcneil Cove, Sloop Island, Wings Point, Town Farm Bay, North West Bay, Willsboro Point, Porter Bay, Ligonier Point, Louis Clearing Bay and Fields Bay. This includes Interstate 87 between mile markers 112 and 131. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
